event_type.category: Player Transfers, Trades, and Contract Signings

0.summary: A second-division women’s basketball team has filled its final roster spot before the domestic transfer deadline by signing its veteran point guard to a one-year extension with a reduced salary and incentives tied to games played following last season’s injury layoff.

outline.sentence: {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} announced the signing of a one-year contract extension with veteran point guard {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} as their final roster move before the domestic transfer deadline.

The club published the extension in an official press release on the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} website and social channels and completed the paperwork at the team's training facility with the head coach and general manager present.
{Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} registered contract terms that reduce {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1}'s base salary and include game-play incentives tied to minutes and appearances for the one-year extension.

The recorded incentive structure includes per-appearance fees, stepped bonuses for reaching specific minutes thresholds in individual games and incremental payments tied to appearing in a target proportion of regular-season fixtures.
{Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} completed a club medical assessment and monitored return-to-play program overseen by {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} after an injury layoff last season.

The medical assessment consisted of strength and conditioning benchmarks, on-court movement and shooting tests and cardiovascular screening administered over a short monitoring period, with the club medical staff clearing {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} to progress into full-team contact training.

{Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} filed the finalized roster that includes {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} with league administrators ahead of the domestic transfer deadline to secure the squad for the opening fixtures.

The club submitted the roster to league administrators that afternoon and received confirmation of registration from the league, ensuring {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} is officially eligible for selection when the team begins competition.
{Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} issued a short statement through {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} expressing commitment to earn playing time and to meet the incentives specified in the new contract.

In the club-released statement {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} said, "I'm focused on earning my minutes, getting fully fit and doing whatever it takes to help {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} compete this season."

continuation.summary: Maya Cortes completed a supervised full-contact training session without setbacks and was listed by Rivermark Lynx as available for selection for the season opener.

1.summary: Maya Cortes completed a supervised full-contact training session without setbacks and was listed by Rivermark Lynx as available for selection for the season opener.

outline.sentence: {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} completed a supervised full-contact training session without setbacks on 2025-08-29 observed by {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} medical and coaching staff.

The full-contact training session lasted approximately 75 minutes at the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} training facility in Harborfen and included controlled live scrimmage periods designed to replicate match contact situations.
{Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} medical staff reported no acute pain or functional limitations for {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} in post-session assessments.

Post-session assessments by the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} medical team recorded zero on a standard 0–10 pain scale, normal bilateral range-of-motion in the knee and ankle, and satisfactory single-leg hop performance during functional testing.
{Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} head coach placed {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} on the available-for-selection list for the season opener after consulting with {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} medical staff.

{Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} head coach noted that inclusion on the available-for-selection list is contingent on following a minutes-management plan that will initially limit {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} to a planned rotation of under 20 minutes while monitoring match response.
{Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} submitted a match-day availability notice to league administrators naming {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} as eligible for selection for the season opener.

{Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} submitted the match-day availability notice through the league's official portal and received an automated confirmation receipt from league administrators confirming the submission.
{Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} told assembled media, "I'm ready to contribute under the minutes plan the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} sets," after the training session.

{Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} spoke to reporters outside the main court, smiling and accompanied by the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} physiotherapist, and added that {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} plans to focus on defensive intensity and on-court leadership while adhering to {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1}'s minutes plan.

continuation.summary: Later on 2025-08-29 a pre-game assessment recorded mild knee swelling for Maya Cortes, prompting Rivermark Lynx medical staff to withdraw her from the finalized match-day roster and arrange same-day ultrasound imaging and anti-inflammatory treatment with an overnight re-evaluation to determine short-term availability.

2.summary: Later on 2025-08-29 a pre-game assessment recorded mild knee swelling for Maya Cortes, prompting Rivermark Lynx medical staff to withdraw her from the finalized match-day roster and arrange same-day ultrasound imaging and anti-inflammatory treatment with an overnight re-evaluation to determine short-term availability.

outline.sentence: {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} medical staff recorded mild swelling in the right knee of {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} during a pre-match physical assessment on 2025-08-29.

The {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} physiotherapist recorded a mid-patellar girth difference of approximately 1.4 cm when comparing the right knee to the left and noted a small suprapatellar fluid wave on bedside palpation at about 17:10 local time.
{Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} medical staff withdrew {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} from the finalized match-day roster following the pre-match assessment on 2025-08-29.

The {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} head of medical services informed the head coach and submitted the formal withdrawal through the league match-day change portal at 17:25, with arena match officials informed shortly thereafter.
{Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} medical staff scheduled same-day diagnostic ultrasound imaging for {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} at {Harborfen Diagnostic Centre|ORGANIZATION-2} on 2025-08-29.

The {Harborfen Diagnostic Centre|ORGANIZATION-2} appointment was booked for 18:00 and the imaging request specified a focused musculoskeletal ultrasound of the patellofemoral region including longitudinal and transverse views and Doppler assessment to evaluate for effusion or tendon pathology.

{Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} medical staff administered a single oral anti-inflammatory dose and applied an ice-compression protocol to {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} while awaiting ultrasound results on 2025-08-29.

The {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} physiotherapist administered 400 mg of {ibuprofen|PRODUCT-1} orally and applied a pneumatic cold-compression cuff set to approximately 6°C in 20-minute cycles while recording pre- and post-treatment pain scores on a 0–10 scale.

{Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} scheduled an overnight re-evaluation for {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} with {Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} at {Harborfen Diagnostic Centre|ORGANIZATION-2} to determine her short-term availability for selection.

The re-evaluation with {Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} was scheduled for 08:00 the following morning and was planned to include a repeat clinical examination, review of the ultrasound images, standardized knee range-of-motion measurements, and a documented minutes-management recommendation to be communicated to the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} coaching staff after the assessment.

continuation.summary: On 2025-08-30 at 08:00 Dr. Elias Verran reviewed the ultrasound and repeat clinical measures and cleared Maya Cortes for match selection under a conservative initial 10–12 minute cap with daily symptom checks and a one-week functional review to reassess load tolerance.

3.summary: On 2025-08-30 at 08:00 Dr. Elias Verran reviewed the ultrasound and repeat clinical measures and cleared Maya Cortes for match selection under a conservative initial 10–12 minute cap with daily symptom checks and a one-week functional review to reassess load tolerance.

outline.sentence: At 08:00 on 2025-08-30 {Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} reviewed the focused musculoskeletal ultrasound images supplied by {Harborfen Diagnostic Centre|ORGANIZATION-2}.

{Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} recorded a small anechoic suprapatellar effusion on the images measuring approximately 7–9 mm in depth, noted intact patellar and quadriceps tendon continuity, and observed no focal Doppler hyperemia suggestive of active tendinopathy.
At 08:15 on 2025-08-30 {Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} performed a repeat clinical examination and documented standardized knee range-of-motion and symptom scores for {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1}.

{Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} documented active knee extension of 0° and flexion to 135° bilaterally, a resting visual analogue pain score of 1/10 rising to 2/10 with single-leg squat provocation, and stable anterior drawer and Lachman tests with no joint-line tenderness.
At 08:35 on 2025-08-30 {Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} cleared {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} for match selection with an initial conservative minutes cap of 10–12 minutes.

The minutes cap was defined as total in-game time per match for the immediate fixtures, to be delivered in no more than two separate stints and with coaching instructed to minimise prolonged high-intensity defensive minutes during each appearance.

On 2025-08-30 {Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} instructed the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} medical team to perform daily symptom checks for {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} before and after training and match activity.

{Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} asked the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} physiotherapist to record a pre- and post-activity 0–10 pain score, a brief patellar girth measure, a 30-second single-leg balance assessment, and any analgesic use, and to upload these entries to the club medical portal within two hours of each check.

On 2025-08-30 {Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} scheduled a one-week functional review at {Harborfen Diagnostic Centre|ORGANIZATION-2} to reassess load tolerance for {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} and notified {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} coaching staff of the plan.

The one-week functional review was booked for 09:00 on 2025-09-06 at {Harborfen Diagnostic Centre|ORGANIZATION-2} and will include repeat targeted ultrasound, standardized isokinetic quadriceps/hamstring strength testing and a monitored five-minute on-court conditioning set to determine criteria for incremental minutes increases.

continuation.summary: On 2025-09-05 the Rivermark Lynx physiotherapist uploaded daily monitoring entries showing a small overnight increase in right-knee mid-patellar girth (+0.8 cm), a pre-activity pain score of 3/10 and one 400 mg ibuprofen taken the previous evening, prompting the club to withdraw Maya Cortes from all on-court team activities and arrange an expedited same-day focused ultrasound with an urgent clinical review by Dr. Elias Verran.

4.summary: On 2025-09-05 the Rivermark Lynx physiotherapist uploaded daily monitoring entries showing a small overnight increase in right-knee mid-patellar girth (+0.8 cm), a pre-activity pain score of 3/10 and one 400 mg ibuprofen taken the previous evening, prompting the club to withdraw Maya Cortes from all on-court team activities and arrange an expedited same-day focused ultrasound with an urgent clinical review by Dr. Elias Verran.

outline.sentence: {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} physiotherapist {Sofia Harlow|PERSON-3} uploaded daily monitoring entries for {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} to the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} club medical portal on 2025-09-05.

The uploaded entry was submitted at 09:12 local time through the {Rivermark Lynx secure medical portal|PRODUCT-2} using the club's standardized daily-monitoring template and was time-stamped and made visible to the head of medical services and the physiotherapy team.
The uploaded monitoring entry for {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} recorded an overnight increase in right-knee mid-patellar girth of +0.8 cm in the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} medical log.

The mid-patellar girth measurement was performed with a calibrated flexible tape at the anatomical mid-point of the patella with {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} supine and the knee in full extension, and the result was entered to the nearest 0.1 cm per the club's measurement protocol.
The uploaded monitoring entry for {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} recorded a pre-activity pain score of 3/10 and documented one 400 mg {ibuprofen|PRODUCT-1} taken the previous evening.

The entry noted that {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} self-reported taking the single 400 mg {ibuprofen|PRODUCT-1} dose at approximately 21:30 the previous evening and that the pre-activity 3/10 pain score was recorded at 08:50 immediately prior to the scheduled morning session.

Following the monitoring entries, {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} withdrew {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} from all on-court team activities and arranged an expedited same-day focused musculoskeletal ultrasound at {Harborfen Diagnostic Centre|ORGANIZATION-2}.

{Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} submitted a formal non-availability notification on the club management system at 09:35, secured an expedited ultrasound appointment at {Harborfen Diagnostic Centre|ORGANIZATION-2} for 14:30 the same day, and arranged for physiotherapist {Sofia Harlow|PERSON-3} to accompany {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} to the imaging using the club medical vehicle.

{Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} notified {Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} and scheduled an urgent clinical review with {Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} to follow the focused ultrasound while {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} informed the head coach and league administrators of {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1}' temporary non-availability for selection.

{Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} was alerted via encrypted email and an urgent phone call at 09:40 with the plan to perform a clinical review within two hours of the completed ultrasound, and the club also updated the league portal with a temporary 'medical' status and phoned the head coach to brief him on {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1}' non-availability.

continuation.summary: Following the expedited 14:30 ultrasound on 2025-09-05, Dr. Elias Verran advised Rivermark Lynx to keep Maya Cortes unavailable and to obtain urgent MRI imaging with a conservative 7–10 day period of relative rest plus anti-inflammatory measures before any graded return-to-play decisions.

1.headline: Maya Cortes Cleared for Season Opener After Successful Full-Contact Session with Rivermark Lynx
passages: On 2025-08-29 veteran point guard {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} completed a supervised full-contact training session without setbacks at the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} training facility in Harborfen, observed by the club’s medical and coaching staff. The session lasted approximately 75 minutes and included controlled live scrimmage periods designed to replicate match contact situations.

Post-session assessments by the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} medical team recorded a zero on the standard 0–10 pain scale, documented normal bilateral range-of-motion in both the knee and ankle, and found satisfactory single-leg hop performance during functional testing. After consulting with medical staff, the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} head coach placed {Cortes|PERSON-1} on the available-for-selection list for the season opener and the club submitted a match-day availability notice to league administrators naming {Cortes|PERSON-1} as eligible for selection.

The head coach noted that inclusion on the available-for-selection list is contingent on a minutes-management plan that will initially limit {Cortes|PERSON-1} to a planned rotation of under 20 minutes while the team monitors her match response. Smiling and accompanied by the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} physiotherapist outside the main court, {Cortes|PERSON-1} said she plans to concentrate on defensive intensity and on-court leadership while adhering to the team’s minutes plan as the season begins.

2.headline: Rivermark Lynx Withdraw Veteran Point Guard Maya Cortes After Pre‑Match Knee Assessment
passages: {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} medical staff withdrew veteran point guard {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} from the finalized match-day roster on 2025-08-29 after a pre-match physical assessment detected mild swelling in her right knee. The club physiotherapist recorded a mid-patellar girth difference of approximately 1.4 cm when comparing the right knee to the left and noted a small suprapatellar fluid wave on bedside palpation at about 17:10 local time; the head of medical services informed the head coach and submitted the formal withdrawal through the league match-day change portal at 17:25, with arena match officials informed shortly thereafter.

Following the assessment, an appointment at the {Harborfen Diagnostic Centre|ORGANIZATION-2} was booked for 18:00. The imaging request specified a focused musculoskeletal ultrasound of the patellofemoral region, to include longitudinal and transverse views plus Doppler assessment to evaluate for effusion or tendon pathology. On-site treatment administered by the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} physiotherapist included 400 mg of {ibuprofen|PRODUCT-1} taken orally and application of a pneumatic cold-compression cuff set to approximately 6°C in 20-minute cycles; pre- and post-treatment pain scores were recorded on a 0–10 scale.

A re-evaluation with {Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} is scheduled for 08:00 the following morning and will include a repeat clinical examination, review of the ultrasound images, standardized knee range-of-motion measurements, and a documented minutes-management recommendation to be communicated to the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} coaching staff after the assessment. {Cortes|PERSON-1}, a driven and disciplined veteran known for leadership and mentoring younger players, will be assessed as the club determines next steps.

4.headline: Maya Cortes Withdrawn by Rivermark Lynx After Right‑Knee Swelling; Same‑Day Ultrasound Booked
passages: {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} withdrew veteran point guard {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} from all on‑court team activities on 5 September after a medical monitoring entry — submitted at 09:12 local time through {the club’s secure medical portal|PRODUCT-2} using the standardized daily‑monitoring template — recorded an overnight increase in right‑knee mid‑patellar girth of +0.8 cm in the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} medical log. The entry was time‑stamped and made visible to the head of medical services and the physiotherapy team, and it also logged a pre‑activity pain score of 3/10 and noted that {Cortes|PERSON-1} had taken one 400 mg {ibuprofen|PRODUCT-1} the previous evening. Following those findings, the club arranged an expedited same‑day focused musculoskeletal ultrasound at {Harborfen Diagnostic Centre|ORGANIZATION-2} and informed the head coach and league administrators that {Cortes|PERSON-1} would be temporarily unavailable for selection.

The club’s monitoring notes specified that the mid‑patellar girth measurement was performed with a calibrated flexible tape at the anatomical mid‑point of the patella with {Cortes|PERSON-1} supine and the knee in full extension, and the result was entered to the nearest 0.1 cm in accordance with the {Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} measurement protocol. {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} submitted a formal non‑availability notification on the club management system at 09:35, secured an expedited ultrasound appointment at {Harborfen Diagnostic Centre|ORGANIZATION-2} for 14:30 the same day, and arranged for physiotherapist {Sofia Harlow|PERSON-3} to accompany {Cortes|PERSON-1} to the imaging using the club medical vehicle.

{Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} notified Consultant Sports Medicine Physician {Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} and scheduled an urgent clinical review with {him|PERSON-2} to follow the focused ultrasound, with further management to be determined after that assessment.

4.headline: Rivermark Lynx Withdraw Maya Cortes After Right-Knee Swelling; Same-Day Ultrasound and Urgent Medical Review Scheduled
passages: {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} physiotherapist {Sofia Harlow|PERSON-3} uploaded daily monitoring entries for {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} to the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} club medical portal on 2025-09-05, prompting the club to withdraw the veteran point guard from all on-court team activities and arrange an expedited same-day focused musculoskeletal ultrasound at {Harborfen Diagnostic Centre|ORGANIZATION-2}. The uploaded entry — submitted at 09:12 local time through the {Rivermark Lynx secure medical portal|PRODUCT-2} using the club's standardized daily-monitoring template — was time-stamped and made visible to the head of medical services and the physiotherapy team, and recorded an overnight increase in right-knee mid-patellar girth of +0.8 cm in the {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} medical log. The mid-patellar girth measurement was performed with a calibrated flexible tape at the anatomical mid-point of the patella with {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} supine and the knee in full extension, and the result was entered to the nearest 0.1 cm per the club's measurement protocol; the entry also recorded a pre-activity pain score of 3/10 and documented one 400 mg {ibuprofen|PRODUCT-1} taken the previous evening.

Following the monitoring entries, {Rivermark Lynx|ORGANIZATION-1} submitted a formal non-availability notification on the club management system at 09:35, secured an expedited ultrasound appointment at {Harborfen Diagnostic Centre|ORGANIZATION-2} for 14:30 the same day, and arranged for physiotherapist {Sofia Harlow|PERSON-3} to accompany {Maya Cortes|PERSON-1} to the imaging using the club medical vehicle. The club notified {Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} and scheduled an urgent clinical review with {Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} to follow the focused ultrasound while informing the head coach and league administrators of {Cortes'|PERSON-1} temporary non-availability for selection; {Dr. Elias Verran|PERSON-2} was alerted via encrypted email and an urgent phone call at 09:40 with the plan to perform a clinical review within two hours of the completed ultrasound, and the club also updated the league portal with a temporary 'medical' status and phoned the head coach to brief him on {Maya Cortes'|PERSON-1} non-availability.
